boardgame.name: Guards of Atlantis II
boardgame.description:
Guards of Atlantis: Tabletop MOBA is a competitive "zero-luck" team-based board game inspired by computer games of the MOBA genre.

In the game, each player controls a single hero and uses a hand of cards to move that hero around the game board, employ special abilities, and attack enemies. Defeating enemy minions earns you coins, which are used to buy levels and upgrade your hero. Your goal is to help your "minions" — units that are not directly controlled by the players — reach the enemy base and capture it.

Guards of Atlantis II is a complete overhaul of the original game with 22 new heroes, new double-sided game board and much more. In addition to new content, Guards of Atlantis II streamlines the rules of the original, making it faster and tighter.

boardgame.name: Revenant World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The gods are dead, the New World Order is up and running, and trans-dimensional portals are interrupting morning commutes. Welcome to the city of Polis. Revenant World is a tabletop role-playing game where you and a group of friends will take on the roles of Vagabonds-- rebellious adolescents from Polis just doing their best to navigate the treacherous halls of high school as well as the alien worlds of the Microcosmic Plane.

Boasting a robust, fast-paced combat system, freeform crafting mechanics, and a unique two-part Class and magic system that gives rise to 1,920 unique abilities, Revenant World is your portal to a vibrant science fantasy world filled with undead gods, uptight law enforcement, fearsome monsters, and teen angst in outer space.

What could go wrong?

Revenant World uses a conflict-resolution system inspired by the Powered by the Apocalypse family of games, where players roll all the dice and the GM makes reactionary moves, keeping the flow of gameplay fast-paced and dynamic.

Players have lots of control over how to make their character, with 8 races, 10 Jobs (Fighter, Thief, Witch, etc.) and 12 Arcana (Heat, Storm, Soul, etc.). Jobs and Arcana combine to make 120 unique character Classes, each with their own list of magical abilities that allow them to shape the world in unpredictable ways by combining a magical effect from your Job with an elemental supply from your Arcana.

Leveling up offers a lot of freedom as well. When you've earned the requisite XP, you can choose to spend it on an upgrade to health or stamina, or on a new ability of your choice. You can also save XP to use during gameplay for a variety of effects.

Players also have access to the open-ended Synthesis mechanic, a crafting system that allows them to fuse mundane objects into useful tools and weapons, prioritizing the combat Manuevers they want to favor. Do you want to be better at hitting one enemy really hard, or hitting all the enemies at once? Grappling or disarming? Dodging or blocking? Whatever skills you prioritize when crafting your gear, the GM will choose which other skills you have to sacrifice in return.

boardgame.name: 4 Letter Words
boardgame.description:
4 Letter Words is the fun, strategic card game in which you connect cards, as you try to create the most words, and score the most points, possible!

How To Play
Select a player to keep score for each participant, as the game progresses, buy use of a writing instrument and a piece of paper. Next, shuffle the deck, deal each player 5 cards, and set it face down. Draw 1 card and place it face-up in the centre of the playing area. The player left of the dealer has the first turn.

For each turn, a player may place any card held on an open side of any card on the playing surface that create a 4 letter word, in a grid that expands in any direction, which scores the player points on the card played. If multiple words are created by the play, the card's score is multiplied by the number of words made. Thereafter, the player may play additional card, up to all 5 held at the beginning of the turn. The total score earned on all cards played is multiplied by the number of cards played, as a bonus. All cards played during a turn must be linked by at least one side. All words created must be found on the "4 Letter Word List" card.

To end a turn, the player draws cards to replenish his or her hand to a total of 5. If a player is unable to play even a single card, the turn is forfeited. Play continues clockwise until all cards have been placed.

The player with the highest score wins!

boardgame.name: Quarrelsome Creatures
boardgame.description:
How To Play
Shuffle the deck and deal each player a hand of 11 cards. Set the remaining cards aside.

Each trick (or turn) of the game consists of every player placing 1 card into the middle of the playing surface, in clockwise order.

The player to the dealer's left begins the game.

For each trick, the first card played must be one of the game's 8 suits– cat, zombie, werewolf, witch, vampire, ghost, monster or mummy. Subsequent cards played in a trick must follow suit, unless a player does not have a card of said suit, or holds a special (!) card (which may be played instead). The player with the highest value card played, of the dominant suit, takes the trick. Players score 1 point for every card of any type taken, as well as bonus/penalty points listed on special cards.

The trick taker begins the next turn. Special cards cannot be used to start a trick. If the player starting a trick has only special cards to play, all remaining tricks of the hand are void, along with that player being assessed a -15 point penalty.

The first player to 100 points, wins!

boardgame.name: Hot Circle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hot Circle is a spark (fan hack) flung from the Burning Wheel by Luke Crane. It attempts to miniaturise and abstract the intricate technology that powers the Burning Wheel to a minimum derivative game.

It's a self contained hack that replaces things that involve long lists in Burning Wheel (traits, skills, lifepaths) with freeform descriptors in the style of Over the Edge, Fate, etc. From this base the framework is extended with compromises (replacing scripted conflicts), conditions, ability tests (using lifepaths to generate circles, wises, resources, and deeds aka flashbacks), and a modified artha cycle (coupled to advancement and compel interactions).

User summary:

The game is available in two formats - one for screen reading, one for printing in "zine" format (folded, stapled). A one-page character sheet also is distributed with the game.

boardgame.description:
Publishers' blurb:

Temelpa, an ancient walled city on a forgotten trade route, thought to be abandoned ages ago, and now, the adventurers find themselves besieged within.

Unable to leave their refuge, the adventurers will quickly discover the city is inhabited, not deserted as initially believed, by an ancient society. They will soon be embroiled in the affairs of a twisted caste system built on servitude and cannibalism and headed by an inter-dimensional vampiric overlord.

This open-ended adventure allows the GM to unleash an array of unique monsters, factional power struggles, and intriguing plots upon the characters as they fight and scheme to stay alive, entrapped in a hostile city where they are viewed as useful pawns or a tasty exotic meal.

Can the characters hold out until the siege is broken and escape with their lives? Will they champion the cause of the downtrodden and upend the social order? Or will they be the main course for the next cannibalistic feast?

boardgame.name: トマトラキュラ (Tomatorakyura)
boardgame.description:
User summary
トマトラキュラ (Tomatorakyura) is a Japanese worker placement game with repuatation as a heavy Euro belying its cute theme and graphic design. The action plotting mechanic is drawing attention as possibly unique. The game title is a pun on the name Dracula; the publisher suggests 'Tomato-la-cula' but 'Tomatracula' is a closer match.

The publisher says:
Theme: In Dracula’s world, tomato juice is a huge hit! Players take the roles of Dracula’s minions vying to create the most delicious tomato juice before the banquet at the end of the game’s five rounds.

System: “Shift - Work - Plotting” At the beginning of each round players use the tiles representing the minions’ powers to plot which actions they will take and at what level of power they will take them.

Win condition: There are two scoring rounds and points are earned for the ripeness (number) and brand (color) showing on your tomato dice, card effects, and progress along the game track.

Publisher's summary
【テーマ】ドラキュラ界ではトマトジュースが大ブーム。
プレイヤーはあるドラキュラの使い魔となり、週末（5ラウンド後）の晩餐会で一番おいしいトマトジュースを作ることを目指します。
【システム】使い魔パワーと呼ばれる5つのコマをラウンドの最初に、どのアクションをどの強さで行うかプロットする、シフト・ワーク・プロッティング。
【勝利条件】決算は2回あり、それぞれトマト（サイコロ）の完熟度（出目）やブランド（色）、カード効果やトラックの進み具合で得点が入ります。

boardgame.name: Roku-Roku Shogi
boardgame.description:
Roku-Roku Shogi means 6-6 Shogi and is a Shogi variant using a 6x6 board and 12 standard shogi pieces for each player: 6 Pawns, 1 King, 1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Knight, 1 Lance, and either 1 Rook or 1 Bishop.

Pawns start at second and fifth rank.
Players take turns placing their non-pawn pieces, one at a time, at the first and sixth rank, respectively.

When all pieces are on board (and the left over Bishops or Rooks are returned to the box) play starts according to standard Shogi rules.

Published 31th July 2018 in newspapers and the web in in Tendo, Yamagata Prefecture, Japan.
Designed by the Tendo branch of the Japan Shogi Association in cooporation with Prof. Michio Matsuda.

For anyone further interested in Roku-Roku Shogi google:
66 将棋
or
ろくろく 将棋

boardgame.name: DEKU
boardgame.description:
DEKU is a party game that comes with two stand-up artist model figures, a die, words and phrases on cards, and multiple blocks. You use the box to create a double-sided stage of sorts, with teams facing one another and a wall on the stage between the teams.

In a round, someone rolls the die, then one player on each team starts trying to recreate the word or phrase using the artist model figure and any number of blocks. Once one person is finished, they count from 10 to 0, then the other player must stop. They then rotate the stage to show their creation to their other teammates, who try to guess what the person was trying to represent.

boardgame.name: Fake Town Crier
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The kingdom is in peril! Well, at least its diplomats are.

The realm of Flat Lakes is undergoing a major catastrophe. The various factions cannot reach a single decision, and the reigning monarch has so many publicity events to handle, there is no possible way to manage the complicated situation.

Fortunately, there are the faithful town criers, who bellow the news every morning outside the castle windows. All of the information the monarch needs to make a decision will be delivered by these vocal purveyors of information both true and…less than true.

You are the daring reporters who are trying to get the scoop on the goings-on in the kingdom, and your words will find their way to the monarch’s ear. You have the ultimate power: throw all of your (apparent) journalistic integrity behind one faction and leave the rest in the dust, shaping the very future of your kingdom. Or you could just make it up as you go along – who’s ever going to know the difference?

boardgame.name: Blood Red Blossoms
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Blood Red Blossoms is set in Japan during the Sengoku Jidai (Age of Warring States), an era of ceaseless conflict between feudal lords throughout the whole country. Despite eventually leading to the unification of Japan, the chaos and suffering caused by this power struggle are twisting and corrupting the supernatural beings inhabiting the land: demons are growing stronger, and even neutral or once-helpful spirits have become fickle and vicious. Unquiet ghosts stalk the bloodsoaked battlefields at night, and demonfires lead travelers astray. Foxes and crow demons haunt the woods.

boardgame.name: よくばりパフェ (Yokubari Parfeit)
boardgame.description:
User summary
よくばりパフェ (Yokubari Parfeit) is a Japanese game of push your luck, eating delicious cakes and ices. Players roll the dice against the cards drawn, and try to consume the luxurious cakes. But if the cakes are too sweet or too cold, the player cannot take the 'mouth burst' and fails (run to the bathroom!). Players can choose to swallow early on, and reduce the cards they hold. But if you take too long, other players will finish before you.

The game has very cute graphics, but Japanese reviewers say it is contrary and the decisions are hard for a party game.

Publisher's summary
Shake the dice and pull up the mountain-like parfait piled on a plate!

Is it already the limit? Is more still possible? ?
If it is not early, other people will eat it!

boardgame.name: I Got This!
boardgame.description:
Get ready to bounce, toss, balance, roll, hop, and laugh!

It's up to you to match your confidence with your competence as you lay it all on the line to prove you can complete the challenges and rack up the most points over nine rounds of play.

The first player rolls the die and then reads aloud the corresponding challenge card. "Flick the button through the ring!"

First, everyone marks a check by the number of points they want to try and win.

Feeling confident? Check nine points. Not so much? Check one point. Feeling like you can conquer the world? Why not play the I Got This card to double your potential points?

Once all the score cards are marked - Start flicking, tossing, balancing, measuring, guestimating, or whatever else the challenge entails.

Successfully complete the challenge? Woohoo! You get to circle the number you marked and keep it as points at the end of the game!

Things didn't go quite as planned? You'll have to cross out that number and cut your losses - OR, if you're convinced all you need is just one more try, you COULD use your Do Over card.

But be careful! You can only use it once!

Keep on playing through the nine rounds of ego-humbling challenges. Once every number on everyone's cards is either circled or crossed out, add up your points and announce your scores.

The player with the most points wins!

Fun, funny, and challenging in ways you've never imagined, I Got This is sure to become an instant family game night favorite.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeonology: La Spedizione
Dungeonology: The Expedition
Stworologia: ekspedycja
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Rocca Civetta, a charming town in the Italian hinterland, which hosts one of the most bizarre universities that the human mind has ever conceived.
In fact, this university hosts the chair of Dungeonology, which deals with the study of the environments and organization of different cultures, especially the most atypical and strange... almost Mythical!
Recently, the faculty lost its professor, and the Dean is looking for a skilled replacement. You are the ideal candidates for this job.

Set in the renaissance world of Nova Aetas, Dungeonology will lead you to the discovery of different Civilizations in order to learn their histories and customs. But be careful: the locals will not always be happy with your intrusion.

The aim of the game is to explore a Dungeon as a Scholar, gathering as much information as possible about the people who live there. Information yields Points, and the Scholar collecting the highest number of Points will present the best Thesis on the studied race.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CATaclysm The Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From the back cover

Da humanz iz ded. No moar fud for us. No moar scratchez for us. No moar protecshun frum teh outsides for us. We haz taken teh earth...

Catain Galileo Furwhisker.

Defend the realm of cats from the evil rat hordes and cruel toads that threaten their world. The time of humans has passed and our beloved feline friends have inherited the earth. They roam the land searching for ancient human relics and Meowgic. Choose your cat. Choose your weapon. And fight for honour, glory, and your ball of yarn.

CATaclysm places the world in the capable paws of our favourite furballs in this easy to learn tabletop roleplaying game. Akinji Entertainment brings a game that is sure to be enjoyed by both cat lovers and roleplaying enthusiasts alike. CATaclysm is purrfect for players of all levels, and whether you are new to RPGs or a seasoned veteran, you will enjoy the witty play and the fresh take on dice-adventure games. Using a simple no fuss mechanic, CATaclysm uses a streamlined ruleset that can be learned and played within a short amount of time. This game makes use of a brand new RPG system that uses a single ten-sided die in conjunction with a cutting-edge new life-management system. Whether you are coughing up fireballs or swinging your cat-o-nine-tails, you will love this fun and action-oriented RPG.

boardgame.name: Crossing the Line: Aachen 1944
突破齐格菲防线：亚琛1944
boardgame.description:
The Game
Crossing the Line – Aachen 1944 is an operational level simulation of the Battle for Aachen, which took place from September 12th to October 21st, 1944. The game is intended for two players but is also suitable for solitaire and team play. The game is played in a semi-interactive way, as only one Division of the active player is activated to conduct actions at the same time and the inactive player sometimes can have one of his Divisions react to specific threats and interrupt the enemy's actions.

The Situation
While Operation Market Garden was in the final stage of preparation, Lieutenant general Hodges led the leading elements of the First Army towards the Westwall fortified line south of Aachen. If successful, he might have the opportunity to drive through the fortified line, crossing the Roer River and perhaps reaching the Rhine River.

Components coming in the game box:

• One rulebook
• One scenario booklet including four scenarios and extensive historical notes
• One 22”x34” map sheet
• 360 extra large counters of which 160 are combat units
• Four Player aid charts
• Setup charts
• Reinforcement & Withdrawals charts

The Scale (from the Rulebook):
• A hex represents 1.2km of terrain from side to side.
• Each turn represents a period of two to eight days.
• Combat units are mostly battalions.

2nd Edition 2022:

Game Contents,


One rulebook.
One mounted map.
448 extra large counters.
Four double-sided player aids.
Two double-sides Setup- and Reinforcements & Withdrawals displays.
One solitaire play track sheet.
Two 10-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Disney Song Challenge
boardgame.description:
In this game, players have to sing songs about their favorite Disney movies.
One player player the role of the judge and, each turn, flip a card with the name of a Disney movie on it. The other players have to be fast and the first one to stand up and sing a song from that movie wins the point. If the judge thinks the song is not complete enough to win the point, he spin the wheel and the singing player will have a additional challenge to complete to earn the point. Then the next player in clockwise order becomes the judge and the turn starts over again. The game ends once a player reaches 5 points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mr. Porter's Tome of Skullduggery Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second volume of Mr. Porter's heists is here! Ten more heists bundled together in one convenient package, climaxing in a confrontation with one of the main villains of Waterdeep: Dragon Heist!

Plunge your characters into an underworld of corruption, theft, death, and money, complete with its own rules, lingo, and protocols. Learn what secrets link the corrupt city of Skullport with the shining jewel of Waterdeep, and use them to make as many dragons as you can. Can your characters come out on top as they pit their wits against the Waterdeep city guard, the pitiful defenses of their targets, and even their own greed?

A shadowy figure that calls themselves “Mr. Porter” always has a job for characters ready for some quick and dirty work. Your characters clearly have the skills needed for some skullduggery; or, at least Mr. Porter believes they’re desperate enough to try. Once you’re in, there’s no going back, but the reward is worth it... isn’t it?

"Mr. Porter's Tome of Skullduggery" is a 40-page supplement that lays out what all this skullduggery business is and how you can use it to add a bit of variety and a little extra money to your exploration of the City of Splendors. It includes a brief history of skullduggery in Waterdeep, an explanation of how to run an adventure like a heist, and a series of 10 heists that are quick to set up and quick to run. Spanning levels 1 through 7, this product is perfect for the adventuring group who wants to see and do more in Waterdeep before they take the plunge into Undermountain.

User summary:

This item also gathers the nine previous entries in the series.

boardgame.name: Aethereal Gaslight
Æthereal Gaslight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world is in the throes of a techno-magical revolution. New sciences and ancient arcana have merged, launching a fantastic new age – airships dot the skies, railroads crisscross the land, and great steel vessels rule the high seas. The emerging art of technomancy blurs the line between magic and technology, and most new developments are fundamentally a combination of the arcane and the technological: elemental engines do the work of a hundred beasts … ethereal telegraphy allows instant communication between distant lands … industrial scale alchemy and mass-enchantment make minor magical boons, once reserved for the wealthy and well-connected, available to the common classes. Swords and bows are giving way to mechanical firearms (though adventurers and monster slayers know well that some foes cannot be brought down with bullets alone), and warfare is entering the age of the War Machine. Techo-magical steam tanks and mighty war-golems replace heavy cavalry, while infantrymen carry repeating rifles and tactical explosives into battle.

This guide is a companion to the D&D 5th Edition core books, used to create Steampunk characters, and run adventures and campaigns in the Age of Æther. This collected edition includes the player's material from Quaint & Curious - Age of Wonder.

boardgame.name: Path of the Street Fighter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Barbarian of the Savage Streets

Born of the slums and ghettos of the largest cities, wits and reflexes honed in the struggle to survive, relying on whatever weapons can be found at hand – or on fists and grit alone. Those barbarians who follow the Path of the Street Fighter are creatures of the savage city streets, often having grown up as gang members, pit fighters, or muscle-for-hire. Every bit as deadly as their counterparts from the wilds, they are most at home drinking and brawling in a sleazy waterfront dive, or knocking out teeth in a shady underground prize fight.

Path of the Street Fighter is a Primal Path for the barbarian class, specializing in unarmed combat, improvised weapons, and street-smarts. The new archetype first appeared as a steampunk-era barbarian option in Quaint and Curious – Æthereal Gaslight, but the path can fit into any campaign which puts a focus on adventuring in the city. This guide includes the path itself, along with supporting rules (skill and background) from Æthereal Gaslight, and a handful of additional options – weapons, fighting styles – that didn't appear there.

Publisher's blurb:

In an always snow-covered and desolate region, a small town called “Howl’s Peak” is located. It used to be a small human community of lumberjacks but due to the harsh environment, most of them abandoned the town. Since then it has become a save haven for half-orcs and other outcasts who log “steel-pines”, an especially durable and robust type of tree for a Neverwinter company.

As the adventuring party finds their way to Howl’s Peak a murderous plot unveils itself: Gurred’s severed head (one of the town’s half-orcs) is thrown into the chimney of the town’s local inn and splatters to the feet of the horrified dragonborn innkeeper Icicle.

But who would do such a thing? There are many possible culprits, Gurred seemed to have made some enemies among his brothers. But what would that mean for the community’s fate?

Across the land, scores of children are swept away during the week before the Winter Solstice, never to be heard from again. While good children are rewarded by Sinterklass with gifts of candies and toys, the most unruly children are left naught but a velveteen sack of coal, a bundle of gold tinted ruten, and a warning. Those children who fail to take heed? Come the next year they vanish, never to be heard from again...

boardgame.name: Elegant Initiative Design
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Elegant turn order design explores different mechanisms that model role-playing game character action sequencing.

Most commonly actions are taken in turns. Turns are born of necessity as real-time or simultaneous activity modelling would be impractical for table top game play.

Turns are not however the most elegant way to model the dynamic nature of play. Within the solid frame of turns can be found subtle nuances that don’t break the foundation but increase the flexibility and adaptability of the system.

A key consideration is how the focus moves between characters and their actions. You can think of it like a camera pointing to a selected character at a time. For example, in a classic initiative order the focus moves semi-randomly between characters based on their initiative.

From the introduction:

I’ve explored post-modern themes and their RPG plot adaptations as unbiased as possible, mainly focusing on what I can read in the news today. I’ve had best of intentions to avoid offending anyone’s political or religious views or be tacky with serious events that have shook our world. That said, many themes today are by nature highly political and some of this is unavoidable. Also, most themes are for mature audiences only and they are edgy and unapologetic on purpose.

Publisher's blurb:

Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires is a world rife with epic adventure, with ancient mysteries to unlock, long lost tombs to explore, and malevolent adversaries to confront. Within are six adventures written by the industry’s most talented authors that will pit you against some of Arcanis’ deadliest foes!

Delve into Patrick Kapera’s Harvest House and discover the deadly secret it holds.

Unearth a lost Myrantian tomb battling both the living and the ancient dead in Jeffrey Witthauer’s Burial Offerings.

Search for kidnapped innocents deep within then Blighted Bog, in Cody Bergman’s Unintended Victim’s.

Trail a thief into the Hidden Canyon of Zhu and face a threat from the distant past in Robert J. Schwalb’s Shadow of the Serpent Men.

Travel into the Theocracy of Canceri in Samuel Cluck & Henry Lopez’s tale of tragedy and revenge, Heart’s Blood, Fire’s Vengeance, and stand before cultists prepared to unleash Armageddon upon the world.

Epic Adventures and implacable foes await you in the Shattered Empires!

boardgame.name: To Die Alone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

4-hour Introductory Adventure

Intro #5

Almeric is a bleeding nation full of petty Princes and Princesses. One of them, now in the twilight of his years, wants help. It’s not immediately clear if he wants your help for himself, his heirs, or his town - Maren. This Prince promises rewards to those who provide aid... But even given your special abilities, what meaningful assistance can a few travelers give over a handful of days? In Almeric, whether you stay or try to walk away, it’s a good bet that trouble will find you.

A Note for Players

Heroes that are naturally meddlers and proactive will probably do better in this module than more passive personalities. While all tables should face significant combat twice (or more...), this module is primarily an investigation and the Heroes will be called upon to interact socially with lots of NPCs.

An Introductory adventure optimized for 3rd level characters.

boardgame.name: Complexes #18
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need a stand-alone map for your virtual tabletop game? Complexes are self-contained maps that are also compatible with Dungeons in Blue geomorphs! Each product includes a stand-alone, ready-to-fill dungeon map drawn in the classic-blue style. They have assorted tricks, traps, and features but leave plenty of space for the GM's additions. All Complexes also include geomorph-ready versions of the GM and player maps that have the added doors, rooms, and corridors required to connect to Dungeons in Blue tiles.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This Complex shows a traditional dungeon complex with a large throne room and many narrow side corridors.

Need a stand-alone map for your virtual tabletop game? Complexes are self-contained maps that are also compatible with Dungeons in Blue geomorphs! Each product includes a stand-alone, ready-to-fill dungeon map drawn in the classic-blue style. They have assorted tricks, traps, and features but leave plenty of space for the GM's additions. All Complexes also include geomorph-ready versions of the GM and player maps that have the added doors, rooms, and corridors required to connect to Dungeons in Blue tiles.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This Complex shows a traditional dungeon complex with a large throne room and many narrow side corridors.

Sort of a Breakout sequel. Where Breakout is played on one rectangle field, in this game each level is played on a field of connected rectangles, or chambers. boardgame.name: Flight to the Moon
boardgame.description:
Post war Soviet space game from 1955 where players land on the moon and return to earth with rockets and a limited fuel supply. The game consists of a board, cardboard rockets and fuel tanks and a dice.

Players roll a dice and move cardboard rockets along a path. During the journey players maybe penalised for landing where a cosmic phenomena occurs or at a space station. Detours are in place but maybe avoided by sacrificing a fuel tank.

Players have a select numbered of spots to descend down to the moon otherwise they continue to orbit the moon until they land on the correct spot. A fuel tank is needed to land and take off. Players can land on the dark side of the moon but will miss a turn.

The return journey to earth has some detours to navigate around and upon earth re-entry (Number 74) if a player has no more fuel tanks then they must wait for another player to pass and tow them to earth.

The winner is the player to return to earth first after landing on the moon.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Talk, You Fiend!
boardgame.description:
Acting as a hired torturer for the Mad King, the goal of "Talk, You Fiend!" is to be the best at your job by inflicting as much pain as possible on the prisoners by choosing to play varying levels of pain cards. Compete against other players to see who is the best at the job, but be careful not to overdo it as the prisoner can only collectively take so pain much before breaking.

If the prisoner survives, the player with the highest pain card wins the prisoner, the points, and the round. If the prisoner breaks then be ready to collect the dreaded "Shame Token". Out-wit and bluff your competitors to see who is the best torturer. The first player to reach 10 points wins the game!

-description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
This is a promo item for Werwölfe Vollmondnacht (One Night Ultimate Werewolf) containing the Junior Tanner character given out for free in Essen 2018.

In those trying times being a tanner was not easy. Still, there was one individual who wanted to take over and get rid of his master once and for all ...

Flow of the game:
The apprentice tanner can be combined with any of the roles from the main game or its expansions. Depending on whether the tanner from "One Night Ultimate Werewolf" is used the apprentice tanner's role during the game changes.

Rules of play:
(apprentice tanner, wakes up at night **)

The apprentice tanner is called during the night phase and opens his eyes. The tanner, with eyes closed, lifts his thumb so his apprentice can identify him.

If the tanner is in the game:
The apprentice wants to take over the tanner's job. He wins if the tanner is lynched during the vote (Should that be the case, the tanner also wins).

If the tanner is not in the game:
(because the card has not been drawn or has not been used)
The apprentice tanner has already taken over the role of his master and has realized that being a tanner is not as fulfilling as he expected ... like his predecessor he wins if he's lynched during the vote.

boardgame.name: Mixed Company
boardgame.description:
Mixed Company is a conversationally engaging card game.

How to Play:

1) Create Your Question Card Deck
Choose from Question Cards including All Ages, 16+, NSFW, or other expansion packs, to put together a variety of questions for your group.

2) Deal out the cards
Deal out Question Cards, Trophy Cards, Action Cards, Challenge Cards, and Vote Cards to each player.

3) Choose Questions
Each player puts out one of their Question Cards and then uses their Vote Cards to vote for the question they want to talk about.

4) Question Round
Have your conversation! You can choose to use only the top pick from the selected Question Cards or go for three rounds. During the Conversation Phase for each Question Card you’ll play your Action Cards and Challenge Cards. After each Conversation Phase, you’ll award a Trophy Card.

5) Wrap Up
If you need to know who “won”, count up your points and see who got the most points.

Free Print and Play:

User summary
関ヶ原 (Sekigahara) is a drafting & bluffing game between the East and West Army.

Deciding which cards to pick from the hand is important; whether to pick a card with the same army, simply choosing a big number, or choosing an enemy card. There are many choices and strategies.
At this time, remember who picks cards that you did not choose. Your memory will have a great impact on the bluff battle held after the draft.

Sekigahara is a dense game packed with many mechanics, but it still a quick game, lasting only 4 bids.

boardgame.name: Cruciverbalist
boardgame.description:
In Cruciverbalist, each player takes on the role of a freelance crossword puzzle crafter. You have to make the best crossword puzzle in order to have your puzzle get published and for you to get paid!

Cruciverbalist is played over 5 to 7 rounds, depending on the number of players. Each round, players will roll 12 dice. With these dice, you will be able to use the conversion table to pick letters and create words to add to your crossword puzzle. Other players also get actions on your turn! Four of the dice are, "shared," and other players may use these dice to form words to add to their own crossword puzzles. In this way, all players can be engaged during each players turn.

Stymied by your roll? That's ok, you can use a helper token to reroll your dice, but you do lose the helper token and those are worth points at the end of the game!

Cruciverbalist is won by collecting the most points, and points are awarded for larger words, longest chain of letters, and staying within the topic of the crossword puzzle. For example, you could put the word "car" in a crossword about animals, but that will cost you points!

Collect the most points and win the title of Champion Cruciverbalist!

This is a roll and write game that was an entry in the 2017 GenCant roll and write contest and received an honorable mention.

boardgame.description:
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Cold War is an expansion for The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire.

After the bombs fell on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and the dust settled from World War II, the nations of the world rebuilt their economies and infrastructure, and the atomic age began. Nations forged alliances through strong diplomacy. They built rockets and satellites and began the space race. They constructed enough nuclear missiles to destroy the world many times over. Their spies were around every corner. The Cold War had begun.

The Cold War Expansion from Minion Games adds new levels of strategy and options to The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire. This expansion requires that game specifically, and not other products in the Manhattan Project game line. The various components in this expansion are divided into separate modules. It is recommended that these modules be added to Energy Empire gradually and not all at once.

Players may pick and choose the modules they like best to customize their game, or even choose to eventually add all of the modules to their game.

Players will find that the Cold War expansion adds many more opportunities for player interaction, and creates many more varied ways to win. Fans will notice that some of the things they are used to doing in Energy Empire might become more difficult, but the new strategic options and paths to victory greatly enhance replayability.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Meeple Source 95-Piece Upgrade Kit

boardgame.name: Novice Novice Table Talk Role Playing Game
노닥노닥 TRPG
boardgame.description:
Novi Novi TRPG is like a tabletop RPG in a box - you can sit down without preparation or a game master and start playing right away.

First everyone picks a character card. Then the first GM picks a scene card and reads it to the scene player, and then roleplay the scene, typically ending with an ability test. Depending on how the scene is resolved the scene player gets a Light or Dark card added to their character and then the GM and scene player cards move to the next players. After three passes around the table you draw a conclusion card and figure out how your story ends.

Novi Novi is designed to be a lighthearted introduction to roleplaying for newcomers or an easy-to-use alternative for seasonsed roleplayers.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Categorickell
boardgame.description:
A general knowledge tug-of-war!

2 teams race to name a thing in the category, starting with either letter on a newly-flipped card! The winner flips the card one ‘step’ closer to their side and covers the previous card, so the next visible card is closer to whoever was first. It’s like a tug-of-war: flip the card at your end and win again to get a point!

There are various styles of categories.

Simple categories (Animals, places, food...) result in games only a few minutes long (and suitable for playing with children in an educational environment).

Specialist categories (novels/films, brands, celebrities, games...) allow one player to show off their specialist knowledge against multiple opponents.

Meta categories (number of syllables, number of letters, rhymes...) require quick thinking and almost entirely eschew general knowledge entirely.

This was the winner of the 2017/2018 Wibbell++ design competition and is the 8th 'core game' for the Wibbell++ deck. Rules will be freely available online on 1st August 2019.

boardgame.name: Šurpu turpu
boardgame.description:
Šurpu turpu (Back and forth) - the game about touring in Latvia.

Did you know there were underground lakes in Latvia? In which forests and swamps are the most exciting walking trails? In this game you will have the opportunity not only to find out about a number of interesting places in Latvia, but also to travel in your own way. You can use boats, trains, and even airplanes to travel, if you have enough tickets for it; if you don't, you'll have to stick to your feet. But watch out for other travelers. They are likely to put obstacles in place to be the first to travel Latvia!
—description from publisher (translated)

The game area is a map of Latvia, its territory is divided into 4 historical counties with a total of 60 viewing objects connected to different roads - pedestrians, railways, rivers and air. Each viewing object have its own information card with a description of it and a small bonus that the player receives after visiting it. To win, you have to visit 4 objects, one by one in each county, and complete the end-of-game task that the players roll out at the beginning of the game.

On his own move, a player can move on the card for up to 3 steps. Pedestrian roads are free, others need tickets. They can be obtained by stopping on a blank, unnumbered field. In the same way, you can get opportunity cards that can be played before you go, helping yourself or interfering with other players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Book of Demons
boardgame.description:
Book of Demons is an isometric hack'n'slash game with elements of action role-playing created by Polish studio Thing Trunk. The game was officially released through Steam on 13 December 2018. The game was originally developed for Microsoft Windows, but the developers informed about plans to release it also on Xbox One. Book of Demons is the first installment of Return 2 Games series that aims to bring classic hardcore genres to broader audiences. The game features unusual art style - all elements of the game (starting from GUI and ending with monsters) are visualized as papercuttings and pop-up book elements, and such style defines the visual framework for the whole series. The game also brings some novelties to the genre - the card system which replaces equipment and skills systems typical for hack'n'slashes, the Flexiscope feature which allows players to control the duration of a game session and movement restricted to a path which adds a tactical element to the gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "Book of Demons", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.description:
A two player adversarial game, you’ll compete with the Social Justice Warriors trying to get away with egregious breaches of ethics before Gamergate can create enough of a fuss and social pressure to expose them, all the while flaming each other on Twitter, screaming for attention and being trolled hard. Gamergate the Card Game, is a trick taking game that is played in rounds. Once an "Ethics Breech" card has been drawn then the two sides take turns playing cards trying to score greater numbers than the other player. Once the the round is over then the player with the higher score wins the "ethics breech" (trick). The player with the higher number of tricks wins the game.
